Reviews__review: We stayed at this hotel last weekend for a softball tournament. We had stay there last year as well. This year the service was disappointing. There is a beautiful patio area in the back but no one could use it because the outside gate key lock was broken. They would not allow access to the patio from the breakfast room. We had a grandparent of one of our players wanting to sit outside to read a book before an afternoon game and her best option was on a picnic table on the side of the building. We asked if she could sit on the patio in more comfortable chairs and the front desk person told us the only way she could get to the patio was if we hoisted her over the fence. Not very feasible for an elderly person. The previous year we stayed at the hotel, the patio was accessible and we spent a lot of time out there. This year the staff was not interested in accommodating our group using a patio that was intentionally built to allow paying guests to use. Because our group was not allowed on the patio, we asked if we could sit in the breakfast room and again, we were told we could not access that space. We will be looking for alternative hotels in that area next summer when our group of 30 needs a place to stay for a tournament.
Run away! The management at this place has absolutely ruined it. Many amenities out of order and unavailable including the pool for most of our stay. …

Mediocre at best. And this below isn't even the half of it. We stayed in the beginning of June 2024.Nearly every single trash can that we encountered in the public areas of the hotel was very full. We did witness the one right outside in front of the lobby being changed Saturday morning. But I do remember on Saturday afternoon, the one by the conference center being very full and not attended to.Saturday morning, someone had their cats in the breakfast area. There were people in our group that are highly allergic to cats. This was all in addition to disgusting tables and messy serving area. We (2 families, not just my family) witnessed a hotel worker walk in, check to see how much food was gone and walk away. She did not replace the napkins (there were none left), she didn't care about the spilled milk on the floor. She didn't seem to care about the disgusting state of the breakfast area at all.Apparently, our block of rooms was overbooked. Our softball coaches did not have a room available to them even though they reserved one. A parent and a player got the last room. Even though their reservations were from March.And to elaborate on a few things, it was raining very hard on Saturday. The parking situation is very poor at this hotel. Our room was near the middle/lobby of the hotel. We ended up having to park way down near the conference center. I got my key card out expecting to have to buzz in but the doors at the conference center were unlocked. We got all the way up to our room on the 3rd floor - without using a key.The trash near the pool - it was on the outside of the building, near the pool equipment. It was outside of the emergency door.... In plain view of people swimming in the pool area.I do have to say, the poor woman that was working Saturday night.... Bless her heart. She was very kind even though she was clearly very irritated with the rude, rowdy and messy kids from Illinois who weren't being controlled by their annebrated parents. (She honestly should have evicted the from the hotel because they were very loud and disturbed everyone!)The workers at check in and check out were also pleasant and made the process fast and simple.Our room was large, clean and comfortable.... Which this family of 4 appreciated.

Run away! The management at this place has absolutely ruined it. Many amenities out of order and unavailable. Hot tub was out of order when we arrived, I called to check to make sure it was back up before driving back this evening and was assured it was up. I found it full of sand only to be told by the front desk attendant(Miranda) that the sand was normal even after showing her these photos. Seriously, stay anywhere else. Also, no towels available at the pool and no waffles and no OJ at breakfast.

Was told they had a pool & hot tub. Get there and it's closed. Reassured that it would be open tomorrow. Closed. Asked for a cancellation so we could go somewhere that has an open hot tub - they said they can cancel it but the cancellation fee will be the same price as the room. Only reason I stayed here is because I wanted a hotel with a hot tub after driving 9 hours. Terrible customer service.

Only thing that this hotel could have going for it is the pool. Great set up for kids, unfortunately the water is too cool and the hot tub is never hot.Hot water in the room was hit and miss, mostly miss.The wifi is completely useless unless you are on the first floor and even then it’s not great.They say your room will be cleaned after the third night, was here for six nights and never even seen a sign of housekeeping. Had to ask for clean towels and coffee.The coffee station in the lobby, I don’t think had the cream and sugars replaced all week. Basket sat empty for two days.The place was quiet all week but on the weekend the noise blows up with the kids running through the halls. Which I could over look given the pool area and being popular for families, if not for all the other problems.Price is cheap, I guess you get what you pay for.Never was a person at the desk, when needing assistance, always had to use the phone to call for assistance
Hotel itself is ok, pool and hot tub are the best things about the hotel. Staff is lacking and not professional. Check in room way longer than it should have. …

Staffing and overall customer service appears to be diminishing here. cleanliness, security, and putting customers first all get low ratings. Room card did not work in 4 of 5 exterior doors. Hotel is clearly falling into disrepair. Breakfast was good.

We had stayed here for a family vacation and booked 3 rooms for 4 nights. The hotel is older and not so kept up. The kiddy pool was really cool but the water is freezing, the floor in the kiddy pad is so slippy as it has no grit and everyone kept falling and the jacuzzi out of order. So that was really unsafe and disappointing. The room itself were okay. The customer service is seriously lacking. Housekeeping is supposed to come on your 3rd night of stay to help get trash, give clean towls and change bedding and we knew this because we called our 2nd night asking when Housekeeping should come by and the front desk agent said only on the 3rd day but they never came the 3rd day. We complained regarding this because we had no towls and the front desk agent stated that they had no clean towls to give because everything was dirty and she told us to call her back around 9pm to see if there were any towls to get and that she couldnt bring them to the room we would have to come get them from the desk. The front desk agent said Housekeeping and managers only work during the mornings and that she's only worked there for 2 months and is by herself working at night and doesn't have any authority to handle the situation. My family and I will not be using this location again.

I stayed for three nights and requested early breakfast to go upon check in. I was told that it is up to the person in the kitchen. I went at 550 am. I asked the lady in the kitchen if I could grab some food and she opened the breakfast doors early for me on the morning of June 11 and 12. The lady was nice enough to let me grab some food because I work at 630am. On June 13 I went and asked a new lady working in the kitchen if I could grab some fruit and  yogurt or toast before heading off to work and she said no. She was rude and when I asked if I could just have some fruit she  rudely told me no. The service is extremely poor and the staff are unhelpful. This hotel needs major improvement on customer service. I have traveled in healthcare for the last nine years and stayed at many hotels and this has never been an issue. I canceled my reservation for next week and will not be staying here again.

Very clean rooms and plenty in of space for a family. Wifi is not great on the third floor, however is great with fast speed in pool area and first floor. Overall very nice hotel close to the interstate with big parking lot.

The room was clean when we arrived. The breakfast had lots of options and was well serviced by lady in charge. The front desk was friendly and always made notes of our comments. The problem we had was getting fresh towels. …

Nice clean hotel with very comfortable beds & pillows.  The room also had a small sofa sectional for relaxing.  The location was a bit odd but not out of the way.   They also had pools indoors & outside. Outside had a nice seating area by pool too.  This is a large spaced out hotel.   I would definitely return.

Greeted by Dwight, excellent employee, very kind and answered all questions. Rooms were clean, coffee was great, one of the best breakfast you've had in quite a while at a hotel. Our room had some ick on the ceiling and wall, but it was spacious. The pool was warm, which was fantastic. Breakfast was delicious.

I'm happy with my stay here. Pretty much everything was top notch, except for the frig/freezer being fully frozen up. I mentioned it to the front desk, but didn't feel like changing rooms. They gave me a small break on the room fee because I'm one that actually uses the freezer when away from home on multi day business trips. I'm satisfied, and will stay here again.

The hotel is in a very noisy location being very close to the highway. The rooms themselves also are not very quiet. We could hear the guests walking around in the room above as the floor would creek and make noise. …

The overall experience was average. The fobs did not let us in from the outside, and we were locked out several times. Also, even though we were very much looking forward after a long day, being able to relax in the hot tub, it was out of order.
The rooms are a good size and the price is fantastic. We have stayed for special occasions, girls weekends, or just visiting family.  …

We are well traveled and have had some pretty terrible experiences, but this hotel has all of them beat. Blood stained sheets, unclean rooms, unprofessional general manager, and made to feel unsafe and unwelcome.
Overall we had a good experience. The check in progress was smooth, the rooms were fairly clean(we did find some used Kleenex behind the bed) and continental breakfast was really good. …

Hotel was clean and the rooms were quite large. Breakfast was a good select of cereal, eggs, sausage, waffles, breads, and drinks. Overall the hotel appears to be in a state of repair. Many things seem to be half fixed. On the second floor a hole was being repaired in the ceiling. One partial sheet of dry wall was installed but still had a large hole and wires hanging from the curling. Pool was large with basketball hoops. Hot tub was large with a jet timer. It does have a kiddy pool with water jets but you need to turn them on from the opposite side of pool area. Overall for the money not bad. Ones of the work is done it should be a middle of the road experience.

Room was dusty with hair found many places. Especially the bathroom. Hair on the lid of the ice bucket. Cable did not work more the half of the stay. When it did work, only half the channels worked. …

This hotel is absolutely amazing, staff goes above and beyond to make you feel welcome and comfortable. Breakfast is fantastic, the pool is the best pool we’ve been to and we travel for work so we go to a ton of hotels. The rooms are HUGE and the price is reasonable. Absolutely would recommend 100%!!

Stayed in one of the suite rooms. Carpet had stains and the couch had stains and a rip. There were clothes under the cabinet in the bathroom and in the bedroom so obviously was not cleaned thoroughly. …

It was not a clean hotel.  The bathroom of our suite still had dried up toothpaste and fake eyelashes on the counter.  …
Good place. Rooms are big. Has breakfast.

Nice facility.   The pool area is great.  Rooms are spacious and clean.Had to wait for breakfast items as they ran out, but was pleasant and said it was coming.    The TV service went out all day.It snowed, and I get that it takes a lot to get everything cleared. I loved everything about this hotel. The pool stays open until midnight. The free hot breakfast was delicious and the room where so clean and comfy. Rooms were spacious with a very comfortable bed. Overall room quality was high. Our room was booked as part of a wedding block but unfortunately, other rooms in the block were not located close to one another. Breakfast was okay, just your typical hotel breakfast.

We arrived at the hotel for a one night stay to get to the pool to find the hot tub was closed. At check in this was not explained and I will add this was one of the things we were looking forward to at this hotel. …

Everything was very clean and well set up. The room was a very good size and the beds and bedding were all clean and well prepared for our stay. The pool is very nice, but it was very loud and crowded, not unexpected for a weekend visit.
Our room was very musty and smelled but the staff was nice.  We weren't able to switch rooms which would have been nice.  Breakfast tasted good - I had coffee, eggs and bacon.

Garbage was not emptied by the ice machine on the third floor. Smelled like dirty dipers. Dogs barking through the night. Complained to the hotel at check out. Didn't seam to care.  No sorry for the inconvenience.  No thank you for staying with us.  I'll look somewhere else in the future.
Need to fix outside access doors that don't work and don't provide security, second stay and still broken from last stay 9 months ago. …

This hotel could be a great hotel if they would update some small things. Paint jobs, locks, improved breakfast areas and updates to the pool area. We like staying here for convenience and the size of the rooms but are disappointed with the quality for the price everytime.

This was our 2nd stay at this location in the past 3 months. The hotel was clean, staff friendly, a great continental breakfast with hot and cold items---if you left hungry it was your own fault,  nice pool area for kids of all ages. …

This is the joint! I love this place because it's a wonderful Water Park experience at a great price. Rooms have always been clean and well stocked. Employees have been kind, helpful, and considerate. The Water Park is great for small kids and the Hot Tub is great for all, nice and hot. If you are in the area I highly recommend this place for a Daycation or a Vacation Getaway, it won't let down. I don't throw five stars lightly.

We stayed at this hotel previously and it was nice and quite clean. This time rooms smelled of urine, had lots of staining, no staffed house keeping. Definitely gone down hill and was still expensive.

location is good and front desk staff was friendly but the queen suite we stayed in needed major renovations. The curtains were very dirty and stained, the couch was torn in multiple places and was dirty. We will not stay in this hotel again and we will not recommend this location to anyone else.

For parents with small kids (ours are 2, 5, and 8) this place is amazing for the price. We came predominantly for the pool and I can’t believe how much attention, in a good way, was payed to it. Staff constantly checked the cleanliness and chemical levels. The hot tub, kiddie pool and main pool are all pretty good sized (sometimes pics online can be deceiving) so it was never too crowded. Considering breakfast is free, that was phenomenal too. Hot and cold options that were constantly stocked and super friendly staff. The rooms won’t blow your mind or anything, but with 2 adults, 3 kids and a dog it had everything we needed and was spacious enough. Every staff member we encountered was polite and ensured our stay was enjoyable. Not a knock on the hotel at all, but if you’re coming with small kids take advantage of the fridge and microwave in your room because there aren’t a ton of family friendly restaurants (other than fast food) in the immediate area.

It was a very nice place to stay.  We were there for a wedding.  All the family stayed in the hotel, which made it easy for all of us to meet for breakfast.  Great food for the breakfast. Lots of variety.  It was nice to all be the same place for the happy occasion.
We were running out of hot water for 3 days. Typically stay at Wyndham Rewards member and regretted trying something new

Where to start, it was an experience for sure. Started out computers were down, so I had to wait to check in. For two nights.  Just want to say that the employees at check-in were awesome . The beds were not bad . Here is my  issue,  I left Saturday morning, put a "do not  disturb" sign on the door,  came back Saturday afternoon,  and all my personal items were scattered all around the room went to complain,  I was told that they made a mistake and that they cleaned my room. Staff were quick to get me a different room, after being locked out of my room the 2nd night I found out they ultimately put me in a room that was not to be rented out due to it "needing a deep clean". It definitely did, it was not very clean at all.Next stay July 2023, on my 2nd day, my hot water was not working and the tub and sink drain was not draining, I let front desk know and they stated it would be repaired within the 8 hours I would be gone. I returned to the problem not fixed, and I don't think it was even addressed. After speaking with the front desk I was put into a different room, supposedly the last available room. This room was utterly disgusting. There was hair and stains in the bed, toenail clippings and other debris on the floor, a thick layer of dust, hair, and grime on not common surfaces, the PTAC unit was full of dust, dirt, and grime as well, the couch was full of various colored stains. I was given clean sheets for the night. When talking to William Miller, the General Manager, he disregarded the hot water issue stating, "well that isn't a quick fix, so yeah it wasn't fixed, they should have put you in a different room." When I told him about the condition of the 2nd room, he was not very apologetic and didn't seem to validate the concerns at all. He stated he would refund my stay, but didn't, I had to call again to request it, and he never returned my call. I can definitely see why his building is in the condition it is in.On my way out, I used a side door, it was not locked, and the security lock keypad was dismantled, making the door accessible to anyone. I see from previous google reviews, this has been a problem for a few months now. I will not be staying here again.

Room was great other than I was right next to elevator. That noise you heard easily in the bathroom but the main room it wasn't noticeable but anyone talking as they used it you heard very clear. Pool was shutdown one of the 5 days I was there without notice but wasn't a big deal for me that day. Pool was very clean and hot tub was great, nice and warm.  Breakfast was good, decent selection for this hotel type. Cinnamon rolls for Sunday was nice. Tea and coffee available all day and there is a small shop with a few things like candy, drinks, aspirin. Check in was simple. Staff was always friendly and the cleaning crew worked very hard to get things ready. Stayed twice and will return in the future.

Out hotel stay at the Comfort Suites would have been rated excellent if the hotel would have heated the pool properly.  We went here for a quick getaway from the Wisconsin cold, only to find a cold pool.  …

The room was beautiful but the room was not cleaned at all. Dust all over bed headboard, counters,bathroom was dirty. Pool area needs maintenance but thepool was nice as well as the hot tub. Breakfast was pretty good enjoyed it. On my way out used the restroom in lobby area it was disgusting and smelled horrible super dirty. Kind of disappointed on how filthy. But beautiful room.disgusting
Almost NO ONE was here, it was amazing. Great pool, comfy rooms, everything well maintained. The breakfast options were awesome too.

There was poop spread all over the men’s bathroom by the pool area for over 2 days.  Hot tub was cloudy and cold.  Kid pool was freezing. Pool was shut down for an entire day when that was the whole reason we stayed there.  …

Nice room and location.  I didn’t appreciate the tone taken with me by reception when I had to change an arrival date on a room I had paid for in advance.  Snarkiness has no place in customer service.  Do better.

The comfort suites was perfect for the banquet we attended. We had a show in the area and it was close to the location at which we were showing. I would recommend it for business or family travel. The pool area was extremely loud with only a few people in there but it looks fun for kiddos.

It needs staff to clean . Floors in main area were never mopped while we were there. Dirty doors. Elevators. Need a maintenance man or someone to stay on top of that. Not enough staff to properly clean the rooms. …

We arrived very late from our travels. Check in was fast and easy. We had a room with a hot tub that we enjoyed very much. We did have to clean it before getting in it however, as there was what appeared to be pubic hairs left behind. …

Beautiful suite with a nice pool for kids and adults.  The price for amenities was fair.  Nice breakfast.  We will be returning!This hotel would have received 5 stars, but the refrigerator was moved from below the television, revealing open wiring.  With a small child in the room, this was a safety concern (easily manageable by placing an ottoman in the way) that should have been addressed prior to the room being made available.
Had our family Christmas in one of their smaller conference rooms. The staff was very accommodating and helpful. The overnight rooms were very comfortable.

Smoke detector was ripped out of the ceiling in our room. Room smelled like it had been smoked in. Whirlpool was out of order during stay and there was rust on the kiddie pool equipment so was scared to use. Only decent thing was the continental breakfast and the front desk staff were friendly.
The curtain was falling out. The shelf the Micowove was dusty. The ice machine room was smelly and nasty.The garbage all over the hotel was over flowing. The pool however was great.
We were only in town for one night but it was the best night sleep I've had in months

The room was overused and overbooked with few updates!  Breakfast was Ok. Staff needs to learn how to use the vacuum cleaner. Lint covered the rollway bed pillows and comforter. Found garbage under the rollway bed. As stated, room meets the bare minimum standards, it does not delight the customer.
We stay in this hotel the day after Independence Day 2015 and were very happy with everything. …

Comfort suites allows anyone to come in and swim in their lovely indoor pool for $5 a head. Recently our family has made it a weekly thing to come here to swim with our kid for an hour or so, and it's a blast, they even have a toddler play pool playground thing. We must have been quite the nuisance though because they started to turn us away at the door saying they do not allow swimming if the hotel is past 50% capacity. I understand rules are rules however this rule simply did not exist for the past couple months. In fact on several occasions we have paid to go swimming while watching people being sent to other hotels as they have no more space. It's never been a problem as the hotel is somewhat business oriented and no one uses the pool. But for one reason or another they have started to enforce this rule in quite a cold shoulder fashion. Our three year old as you can imagine, is not impressed and neither are we. Great hotel with a couple nice employees, just don't cross paths with the manager, as she will most certainly make sure you know of her power as a manager if she so pleases. I will avoid this hotel because of the manager and the manager only.Edit- not sure why the review says it was posted 4 weeks ago, I posted this (as it says above) when my child was 3, he's 7 now. No worries on the closed pool, I assume that's what it is at every hotel/motel at this point in time. I do appreciate the reply, I'll bump my review from 3 to 4 stars, as the review was mainly reflecting on an employee at the time the review was actually posted.

I’ll start off with positives. The pool area, the young man that worked at the front desk and the maintenance guy all real nice! Breakfast was decent with a lot of selections.  ||The beds were absolutely disgusting. We looked at 3 rooms. Stained.  Hairs. Just nasty

The whirlpool was "closed", but it was just broken and cold. The pool was very cold. The parking lot lights shine right in your window. Breakfast was almost an hour late. Otherwise a nice hotel and clean.

Took awile to check-in (understaffed). Pool was freezing. Whirlpool was closed (people where in it though, lukewarm water). Kids pool area was nice (again cold though). Largest and weird issue was parking lot lights were SO bright and shined right into windows, got up to close curtains and couldn't, because thick curtain was just a small panel (didn't shut all the way). And there are parts of the pool area that keep you on your toes by making you question if parts of the walls and ceiling will fall on you. The large pool is insanely cold. The splash pad is awesome, though. The breakfast room is nice, and the rooms themselves are normal and what you expect.
Hotel staff was great. We were very late for a wedding because there was a mix up with the shuttle going back and forth from the wedding to the hotel and we were an hour and a half late. …

Comfort Suites in Johnson Creek, WI.  Very nice hotel with friendly and helpful staff.  Room was very nice - overpriced, we think.  A couple issues. 1. probably a fluke but the AC did not cool properly especially during the day. 2. …

This hotel has so much potential to get a great review. While I expect this was out of the norm, unfortunately, we had a less than par experience. We LOVED the size of the rooms and the pool. The rooms have plenty of space and a large fridge (compared to other hotels). Breakfast was sufficient and while it's not directly off the highway, it's close to lots of shopping and eating.The unfortunate part of our stay revolved around the cleanliness and "repair" of the place. Our bathroom wasn't clean when we checked in (Hair on toilet) and many things were "Out of Order" - Ice Machine, Kiddie pool, soda machine, one elevator, etc. Although management finally rectified them, the service we received after raising some concerns was sub par. Clerks seemed "on edge" and unwilling to resolve some of the issues we had. Customer service is everything and had this hotel made just a bit of an effort to respond to some simple concerns our stay would have been a 3.5-4 star stay. This stay was a 2-2.5 star experience for us.In spite of all that, I would recommend this hotel. However, second chances are rare with me and if the same thing happened again it would demonstrate that there are deeper issues than simply catching the staff on a busy weekend.

The accommodations were spotlessly clean, the pool area was clean and well-stocked with pool towels at all time.  The breakfast was a full buffet of choices.  We had a family suite and it worked extremely well with small children, naps, and differing schedules.

It was your average hotel. The room was spacious. The shower head could be cleaned. I still don't understand why they can't give you the rate that you see on the internet. They always use to be able to do such . If you tell them you want a corporate rate they can do that. I think they should be able to over ride the system.
We had a great experience while staying at this property.  We were a youth group of 19 youth and adults and enjoyed their large pool with basketball hoops, large hot tub and more. …

I made a reservation for a room a year in advance for my daughters wedding and received a confirmation email. Arrive the night before her wedding to be told another member of my family cancelled my room when in reality the family member did cancel a room but this hotel cancelled their room as well as MY room on an obvious error and they flat out refused to except responsibility for this mistake even as all of us stood in in person at the reception desk stating our cases. Despite the fact the we are all very understanding people the whole situation escalated and I was so embarrassed and upset!!!! I had a confirmation email but NEVER received a cancellation email nor could they show me that one was ever sent to me but just a flat out refusal to except responsibility! No apologies we given. We were told that if a room opened up next night, the night of the wedding, we would be first for the room. The next day at the wedding my aunt said they booked her for two rooms but she only booked one but no one called to tell us there was a room available! I had to call and tell them I knew a cancellation was made by my aunt and was expecting a room which we did get in the end but had to handle on my own during my daughters wedding ... where I was going to sleep that night should not have been a worry!!! The next morning at breakfast we discovered we were billed for 3 stays when we only stayed 2! Family of the groom was billed for 4 stays when it was suppose to be 2 as well. My sisters-in-law has to dress in her car because they arrived at the scheduled check in time at 3:00 the day of the wedding and their room was not ready. All the fitness equipped in the workout room either was out of service or rickety, and that's if you could even get into it. ... Save yourself the headache and stay somewhere else. I don't typically write bad reviews but this was the poorest customer service ever!

It was nice, We don't have any complaints. The pool areas was really nice. It was big and had options like basketball in the pool, a small waterpark looking area, plus a oversized hot tub which felt great. The breakfast was good, and the staff were nice and friendly.

My family thoroughly enjoyed the accommodations for the wedding we attending here. The banquet room was very nice and large. Our rooms were very large and included a couch. It was the largest hotel room I've ever stayed in honestly. Breakfast was great. We didn't have time to enjoy the pool, but it looked like a paradise. I'm hoping to return for another family function in the very near future. Especially with the outlet mall so close.
For a first time stay at a Comfort hotel we rate our stay as excellent. Although it was a little difficult to find, it was worth the effort and value. …

We have stayed in this hotel many times for weekend seminars. There is a nice walking trail across the street. Always clean, but furniture is worn. Beds are comfortable,  and good selection of pillows firm to soft. Coffee is not good, so plan to bring your own if you are selective.

My coworker and I were staying at the hotel for a few nights. My coworker was given a room that had not yet been cleaned. My room was clean, but then I noticed there were a few gnats in the bathroom. …

We ended up staying 3 nights ( originally just an overnight was booked) due to bad weather. Christine and the rest of the staff are courteous and friendly. The hotel had expierenced burst pipes due to severe negative degree weather. …

Normally this is a very nice hotel to stay up but was a bit disappointed this time because of the room I was given had a very strong odor of men’s cologne almost like someone had spilled it in there or like someone was still in the room. …

Overall, the hotel and the experience was very nice! The hotel was clean and the staff were polite and helpful. With the exception of the dryer being broken, I would definitely stay at this location again if I were to ever return. I wish the other Choice Hotels I've stayed in were as nice as this one.

Staff very friendly and attentive. Our room was updated, modern and comfortable. Pool and whirlpool where very nice, great temperature. The children's pool area was a little too cold. Would recommend this hotel for business or pleasure!

Very pleased with the up-to-date room, comfortable furniture and fantastic bedding.  It was clean, quiet and comfortable - just what we wanted.  The free breakfast had great variety and was a delicious mix of hot items (eggs and sausage), make-your-own waffles, toast, cereal, granola, fruit and more.  We'll definitely stay again next time we're in the area.
The room was clean & bed was comfortable.  TV did not work, front desk clerk was not helpful.  Grab & Go breakfast had rotten orange in it.  …
We stayed here, while attending a play at the fireside theater in Fort Atkinson. We were a little worried that it wouldn’t be very nice, considering it was a little out of the way. …
This hotel is very nice. Rooms are spacious and clean. A/C gets very cold. Beds and pillows are comfortable. There are no restaurants within walking distance, so plan ahead. …

This is a very nice hotel. Definitely the best anywhere near the Johnson Creek area. When I pulled up to the entrance I was surprised to see that the employees were outside the front door pressure washing the pavement. Removing all the gum and cigarette butts that careless people like to inappropriately dispose of. Once inside the front lobby is spotless and all employees are pleasant and respectful. Thumb up and keep up the good work.

Our room was spacious and clean! Due to construction in lobby, it was a bit confusing to find which set of outdoor access to use (they also have convention center) since main drive up was closed off and there was no signage up to re-direct. …

This particular location was not great. We went for swimming with our kids but the room wasn't great. It was humid and all of the carpet was damp. The thermostat in the room wasnt working and was hot.  Moving to a new room with sleeping kids would be terrible.
We stayed at the Johnson Creek Conference Center Comfort Suites for 4 nights while visiting Johnson Creek for a Can-Am Spyder Rendezvous hosted by Rob's Performance Motorsports.  …

The overall appearance of the hotel, both inside and out, was very lovely.  The room was spacious and inviting.  The desk staff was pleasant and patient, but she had no idea, at check-in, what she was doing.  …

Fine experience. The room arrangement suited the needs if our fairly large group. The rooms are spacious and did not feel cramped. There were a few minor problems with housekeeping. It was nice to have a hot breakfast provided.

Christine Lunz and her staff put together an absolutely exquisite wedding reception for my Son and Daughter-in-law. Everything was so beautiful! The food was great and the entire staff was very pleasant and accommodating! Due to covid we had to change venues but this ended up being a really good thing. Christine's experience and professionalism were apparent from the planning stages throughout the reception. I spoke to a number of servers and bartenders during the evening and was always greeted with a smile and pleasant conversation. They were extremely efficient, accommodating and helpful. I know that putting together a group of people like this is not an easy task. Event planning takes a special person who is dedicated to creating the best possible day for her clients and Christine is certainly that person! We appreciate her and the efforts of her staff to make this the storybook wedding that this young couple had been dreaming of. If you are planning a special event, I highly recommend Comfort Suites of Johnson Creek.

The front desk staff was clueless, I had 3 rooms and was told that they were adjoining, first we were on separate floors, next we were in three different areas of one floor, but the clerk kept insisting they were adjoining. 45 minutes …

This is a great place to stay - between Madison and Milwaukee, WI. We didn't get in 'til after 8:30pm - but pool was open 'til 11 - so the kids got to relax and play and the front desk was very helpful on recommending a pizza place to order …
I decided to take my wife here for a romantic weekend - so I booked a room with a whirlpool and also thinking there would be a working hottub in the pool area too. …

This hotel offers breakfast and it is actually pretty good. The staff is nice and the beds are comfortable. This is probably one of my favorite pools that is at a hotel. It has a hot tub, a kidd-ish are for younger children. That water is less than a foot (I'm pretty sure). The main pool is nice and spacious. It also has 3 basketball hoops (there are balls too, obviously).

Very nice hotel suite I stayed in, with great country setting, but not 2 seperate rooms for a "suite". Had a king bed and a nice modern couch with a small chase separated by a jut out of wall. Tiny coffee maker, fridge, blow dryer, closet towards rear of room near window, not at entrance, so more room at entrance of our room. Iron and standard board, nice. At one end of hotel has a hall, and around corner there is a bar for the hotel. Didn't find it right away, but glad we did, smaller but comfortable. In bar is 2 slot game machines, couch area and TV to the right. Free breakfast is self serve, coffee, waffle machine, juices, small bagels, cereal, etc. in a big room. Machine for food stuff in smaller main entrance. No restaurant in hotel. Nice pool inside! In bathroom of room, has towels below counter, very nice, but no rack to hang, just lay on counter top. A bit of hard water stain, or well stain?? around drains, small though. No deck. Enjoyed our time, very close to mall.
Excellent location with comfortable beds and tasty breakfast with large selection. Great sized pool for kiddies and whirlpool for adults.
Love this hotel that I happened upon earlier this year. It is quiet, clean, nice pool area for the grandkids and close to the outlet mall. …
This hotel is a standard Comfort Suites hotel, nothing to really set it apart. It is more affordable than the nearby Holiday Inn in Watertown. Pool is large. Breakfast had  very limited selections. …

Room was nice until the we saw something on the floor resembling a big. Further investigation revealed it was a dried raisin.  Didn't say anything because it doesn't change the fact and room seemed pretty clean otherwise.  Breakfast was good for a hotel and it was nice they were open until 10 a.m. on weekend for breakfast.  Would be nice to have better access to upper floors from the back.  Forgot key card in room.  Desk was very helpful and friendly getting us back in the room.  Thanks.

Liked the pool area for the kids (ceiling peeling, but didn't affect the fun). Bed was very bad, needs replacing. Carpet is stained in several places. Staff were great in accommodating my request for room. Breakfast was fine - standard for free breakfast.

Nothing but issues with my wife's baby shower.  Charged $200 and were given a room with no electrical (that worked) and no one in the place knew how to turn it on (makes no sense).  In my experience when someone rents a banquet room they almost always need some electricity.  Had we not complained we would have been charged full price as well.  At the end of the day we did get the room comped but it is not at all the experience we wanted after flying in from Texas the day before.  I do not think we will be back.

Our room was so spacious.  It was definitely a good value using our Farm Bureau discount. Original reservations were made at a competitor but with this discount the value could not be beat.  Pleasantly surprise at how nice this facility was.  Staff was friendly and helpful with suggestions.

This is one of the Best hotels I've stayed at. It was not fancy, but it was clean ,nice, large pool, very reasonable rate and Every single staff I encountered was more than friendly and accommodating. The rooms were nice sized . Just a very pleasant experience all around.

Recently stayed here for a girlfriends getaway. Staff were pleasant to deal with and very helpful with directions. The room was spacious and clean- and an extreme value for the size. It is noce to be given the option of a soft or firm pillow! The breakfast area was tidy and well stocked. Thank you for a great stay!

Upon check in we were originally given a room that was already occupied. The front desk fixed it and we had a nice, very large room. The hotel was fine. Breakfast was free but left much to be desired. The coffee sucked but we found the coffee was bad at most places in the area so idk if it was really the hotels fault.

I had to find a room that would allow cats, as I had mine with me.  I was desperate, I had taken my cats with me to Michigan for Christmas (I live in MN), but I was called to WI because my cousin was about to die.  …
We attended a group New Year's Eve celebration at the Comfort Suites. From the time of check-in until check-out the staff did an outstanding job to caring for our needs. …
Had my son's first birthday party in the pool area. The room was great and everyone had an awesome time. The pool water could be warmer but the children didn't seem to mind. …

Although front desk staff was kind and friendly, the cleanliness of the room left something to be desired.  There was long black hair on the wall of the shower and upon moving the curtain, there was more hair around the edge of the tub.  Definitely a turn off.

The hotel was a little off the road but a huge outlet mall was right next door. Jamie, the gal that checked us in was delightful and our room was very comfortable and clean. Our grandkids loved the kiddie pool with the slides and the spa pool was fantastic. Thanks for a great place to stay!
The guy at the front desk was great, he has blue-ish hair and his welcoming personality really made us feel safe and welcome at the hotel!
Food was terrible! Desk staff were surly. Bed was not great. Pool and whirpool were cold, the room was very noisy with lots and lots of kids! …

Clean, safe, enjoyable stay. I’m not sure why you place a character minimum for this entry as I stated my review with four words and didn’t expect to write a mini novel, I suppose this page of the survey was the worst part of my experience with the trip.

Decent place and a value for size of rooms and amenities offered. We have had occurrences where pool area is freezing or kids water area inoperable. Staff is always very friendly and helpful. Rooms are always clean. We always pick top floor as overhead noise can be loud and wake young kids on lower floors.

Nice room, good breakfast.  Very poor housekeeping. Made bed, did not empty garbage, leave clean linens, or take dirty linen. Toilet backed up. There was no maintenance we were handed a plunger by the front desk. No apology, just excuses. Also facility is a distance away from everything and there is no security. Very understaffed.

This hotel was a wonderful surprise. It is located behind the Johnson Creek Outlet Mall but far enough away that you didn't have a lot of traffic. Beds were very comfortable, great breakfast and pool/hot tub very nice. There is even a kid's pool and lounge so you wouldn't have to leave the hotel. I will use this hotel in the future!

Desk clerk was not as cordial as I am used to. Suites are well kept and comfortable. Free breakfast is very good with both hot and cold selections. Very good place for banquets or conferences. Cherry finished furniture in my room had some nicks.

We were there for a 3 night stay. Had to almost beg the cleaning lady for more towels, our room was never serviced the first day, and the floor under the bathroom vanity was quite dirty. Old dog kibble, kleenex and dust/dirt, very unhappy with it. The air / heat unit ran constantly, off switch did nothing. I really hate to see such a nice place deteriorate as there are not many options in this area. Have stayed a number of times but dissappointed with the cleanliness in the bathroom this time. Hope for improvements.

It was okay. The breakfast was slim pickings. Not too pleased with that.  Wouldn't have stayed there if I knew the place was being painted. Gym wasn't available. I only stayed one night so I expected more or even to be informed prior to coming that the hotel isn't how it normally would be.

Bathroom not clean. Not attended to second day either after complaining that it was not clean on arrival. Have stayed in Choice Hotels in Green Bay, WI; Ohio, New York State; all of which were clean and very nice. …
I stayed at this hotel for 7days in a suite. I travel quite a bit for work and although there is absolutely nothing to do in Jefferson creek, this hotel made it better. …
We were worried about the noise level in our room when we came back to the hotel late on the night of our stay, because there was a huge wedding booked there for the weekend. …

Desk staff was great in accommodating our need to be placed in a suitable room for our dog. We were placed near an exit on first floor, so we had an easy time getting in and out to take our dog outside. …

Stayed three days here over the last week, but not in a row. Rooms were nice, employees were nice and patient(except the elderly lady that worked the kitchen, she diddnt seem to understand what was going on in regards to the food area) which surprised me one day when the other lady was there and on top of everything and cheerful.But please, FFS, clean the durn waffle iron it was disgusting 😐.

I noticed that the door to our room didn't fit very snug and so we could hear everything in the hall very clearly. The pool area was very large and great for all ages. The hotel had a regular hot breakfast and a friendly staff.

We werent sure what to expext. We usually stay in the bigger brands but we were very happy here. The rooms are huge and very comfortable. I was able to crack the window at night. (We like it cool at night). It was very quiet. Breakfast wasnt great. The usual breakfast dribble. But i would definately stay again.
We booked a block of rooms for my son's wedding. The staff was so helpful in working with us.  We are really looking forward to the stay in August

This hotel was wonderful! We had a great experience! The staff and management was very helpful and professional! I will be back here next month! Wonderful place for family and friends to stay at. I didn't have to complain not one time! One of the best experiences I've had at a hotel! Keep up the good work!
Have stayed here multiple times in past. Pool is very child/kid friendly. Breakfast one of hte best when we have eaten breakfast there. …
Not enough characters allowed to tell the whole story so in a nutshell-I was charged to stay in a hotel I wouldn’t have reserved a room in at all had I known about the pool being closed. …

Great hotel with water park for smaller kids.  Hotel bathrooms could use updating. Toilet seat was loose and seat fell off-plastic screws fell on floor.  Some black mold seen in grout lines along tub.

Called ahead to make sure pool was open. Once we get check in they inform us that we have to have our temperature checked every time we enter pool area and access is limited. Should also probably update your website breakfast isn’t cereal and instant oatmeal. Our room was filthy! Garbage sitting on the table and under the tv stand. The first night the pool was about 35 degrees I was pleasantly surprised to find it warm enough to swim in the next morning.

We enjoyed our stay at the Comfort inn. A little out of the way, we saw two beautiful cranes on the way in! Room was basic but clean. Check in was a breeze and check out even easier. Appreciated the covered entryway because it was raining as we loaded our luggage into the back of our vehicle.
We have stayed at this hotel many times.  It is a good stopping point between Minneapolis and Chicago.  Some things are beginning to show wear, but all in all it is still a nice place to stay.

The Johnson Creek Comfort Suites was a nice relaxing place to stay during a family member's wedding.  The hotel staff was very nice and accommodating and the room was comfortable.  The hotel itself is close to the outlets.  …

Room was very specious and clean. Hotel is 13 years old but could of sworn it was built just last year. Pool is very impressive with in water basketball hoops, kid/toddler splash zone, and a huge jaccuzi. Extremely quiet location.

Breakfast with good eggs, waffles, etc.  24 hour lemon water, coffee, real creamer.  Microwave and refrigerator.  Extra large room with sofa.  Super clean and quiet.  Great price and close to freeway.  Friendly staff.  Great pool for kids with slide.

Spacious, clean room, however, overpriced, in my opinion.  Large breakfast area with good selection.   Two night minimum which I was NOT  told when making a reservation via phone...they later insisting I was told.  …

Outstanding in every aspect!   Everyone with whom we came in contact was very helpful, friendly, and outgoing.  This hotel has obviously put forth a great effort to maintain quality service and the building is immaculate, very well-kept.  It is very suitable for anyone traveling on business or taking the family for a vacation or trip.

This is the 3rd time this year we have stayed at this hotel.  The rooms are always very clean, staff friendly, and food is good.  My kids love the children's area in the pool because it has a playground in it and basketball hoops in the adult pool.

Once I finally found hotel (not easy at 2am without GPS) and finally found a way to check in desk (hotel front door area under repairs) as front was blocked and poorly marked.  No signage for temp. entry!  …

The pullout bed was so nasty! Crumbs and dirt was all in the corners and under the pillows! Then we find dog food under the foot test. When called down to the front desk they said ok we’ll send someone to take a look! I called back twice and went down to the front desk and no one still has not come to clean it up ! It’s been over a hour and it’s 11:30 at night!!!! Horrible
We had very little time at the motel due to showing schedule.The clocks changed on the weekend so didnt tryeating but meal looked very good. …

My husband and I stayed here for a wedding we were standing up in. We enjoyed our comfortable bed and the breakfast was good. The room was clean and hotel staff was nice. My only negative comment, the front desk did not ask for an ID when I needed a new room key they just handed it out without even asking my name.

This hotel was clean, modern, well-appointed, and staffed by friendly, helpful employees. The room was comfortable and quiet, and there was so much room to walk my dog. I will definitely be staying here again.

Easy check in, room was spacious and clean.  Breakfast was great with plenty of items available.  Staff was always friendly and asking if there was anything they could do for us and asking how our stay was going.  Location of the motel is a little out of the way but easy to find.

A great place to stay between Madison and Milwaukee.  It has a fun pool area with something for everyone.  My 2 1/2 year old grandson loved being able to shoot hoops in the big pool as well as playing in the kiddie slide area.  The breakfast area was well stocked, had plenty of seating and very clean.

Rooms are nice but hotel staff was very unhelpful. They lost my reservation that I made over the phone and had to book again last minute. Thankfully was able to get the same rate! Make sure they send you a confirmation! When I asked about a potential shuttle that was happening for a wedding I attended the staff was stand offish and rude. I ending up getting info about a taxi company from the grocery store instead.

Everytime I have to come here this place disappoints me more and more. The rooms always look like they never get cleaned well after each guest. The staff here are the worst part of the stay. Besides the girl at checkout today she was very kind and professional. I watched her bust her butt trying to get everyone's breakfast and the manager just stood around and didn't decide to help her. They definitely need more people like her working there.

Hotel was very nice and clean. Reasonable rates too. The cost was about the same as other hotels in the area, but those other hotels offered smaller rooms without a refrigerator or microwave, both of which were included at Comfort Suites. …

Upon arrival you could tell the GM, who was working late, really cared about the place. She was very apologetic about the pool not being available that night and offered a modest discount and late checkout to make up for it. The entire place was near spotless and the beds were great!

The rooms are very spacious, the pools are kid friendly, and the staff was friendly and very quick to refill the breakfast food. It took a bit to find a place to deliver but we found food eventually (Pizza Pit). It was a great place to stop for the night
This hotel was definately a nice suprise. It was tucked away in a private area of town but was easy to find. We travel with a dog and were in the area for a dog show. …

Experience here was so-so.  Hotel was clean, staff was friendly, good breakfast.  Pets are allowed & there was a barking dog down the hall.  The light in the fitness center wouldn't turn on during my 5am workout.  …
This is a great hotel. I stay here multiple times throughout the year while taking or picking up my daughter from college.They have nice large rooms and a decent sized pool. …
Overall our stay was good. The only down side was not being able to use the hot tub to relax at the end of the day.

I would have given the facility a lower rating however the staff earned an upgrade.  As a business manager, I’m aware that many people only write reviews when they are unhappy about something, be it real or perceived.  I try to write about the positive whenever possible too.I’m also aware that  some things are not within the control of the employees and should be directed to the property owners.  So, lets start there.  The hotel was generally clean.  It appeared that the carpeting throughout was fairly new but showing use.  In terms of our room, it had a whirlpool tub sitting in the ‘living room’ which we never intended  to use.  It was dated, showing it’s age and the tile around it could have used new grout, especially on the floor along the base of the tub.The couch fabric was pilling and I’d hate to point a black light at it.  There wasn’t an end table or coffee table in the room so there was no where to place a drink.  Please consider changing this soon.So, let’s talk about the bathroom sink.  We found that it was totally clogged and wouldn’t drain.  My wife and I were in a hurry to start our day so we left without informing the staff…shame on us.  In any event, we returned to our room around 3:00 at which time I called the front desk to tell them about the sink.  To my surprise, the woman on the phone told me she would come up and see what she could do to fix it.  I expected them to call maintenance or something…I guess.When she arrived I found out the woman trying to fix our clogged sink was in fact the General Manager of the hotel; Christine Aumueller, working on her day off.  She told us her maintenance man had left for the day and she would do what she could.  After working on the sink for quite awhile, she said that maintenance would have to repair it on Monday and offered to move us to another room.  My wife and I decided to stay in this room and agreed to work around the non-draining sink.  Christine was very personable and accommodating, doing what she could to make things right.A couple other five star worthy highlights were again the staff.  The young lady at the front desk was extremely friendly.  The two women who attended to the complementary breakfast were attentive and made sure everything was freshly stocked throughout our time in the room.All in all, we would recommend this comfort suites and would urge ownership to consider updating more than carpeting.
This place is a gem as far as the facility goes.  But the service is horrible.  Speedy check in and they aim to please, but behind the scenes it is horrible. …

It was a lot of fun, big area. It was $5 a person open swim from 6am to 6pm. Such a nice clean place towels included. It had a shallow kids area with a double slide, a large pool with 3 basketball hoops, and a nice sized hot tub. It was so much more than expected. Warm water in all pools and great temp in hot tub. The only reason I didnt give it a 5 star is because bathrooms were freezing cold and the air outside in the pool area was a little cold for my taste... however that might be because we came on a -25 degree day lol. Will go to this place lots more hidden gem

The accommodations that I chose using the Choice Hotels website and were very specific in the reservation acknowledgement were no provided. I got different asinine excuses from three different staff members at the desk, but no help. No WIFI.

My stay was good, rooms were clean. Breakfast had a variety of foods to choose from, and was freshly made.   There was remodeling going on, and parking lot was being redone, but they allowed us to still pull up to the main doors to unload before having to find a parking spot on the street.

Attended a convention here recently. Hotel, parking, meeting rooms, common areas were just fine and clean. I didn't stay over night. The only issue I had was that the wireless mic and room sound was not that great. We had a ton of speakers and we had to have them stay in a sweet spot in the room of to the side instead of being able to walk or stand where they wanted.
Pool area was filthy and one of the pools wasn’t even working. Garbage was everywhere and food was floating around in the pool.My room had the ac blasting in the middle of winter! …

I have been staying here since 2006.  We travel from Missouri to the annual Wisconsin Sheep and Wool Festival in nearby Jefferson. The recent upgrades have made it even better.  Love the comfortable mattresses and space in the room.  …
We had an incredible four day stay.  The entire staff was accommodating to our entire team and their families.  …

It's ok.  There were issues this time like no hot water in the morning at times and a toilet was nowhere near tightened to the floor. This was in the newer wing too. And it's 2016, can we not get HDTV on cable yet?  Breakfast was fine. Staff was courteous. I like it was a little off the beaten path where it's quiet.  Been staying here many years, but I think I'm less happy here each time.
We were greeted right away by very friendly and helpful staff. Great breakfast in the morning. The room was quiet, my kids enjoyed having the pool to themselves since we stayed during the week.

The Comfort Suites have good staff who are attentive to us when we stay in the area. The grandchildren enjoy the pool. When I ask for a ground level room, they almost always grant me the request. If you arrive after 7:00 PM they are not always at the front desk but we have not had to wait too long for them to return to register us.

The room is extremely comfortable with a premium mattress, clean and well maintained furnishings and a quiet building. My only recommendations might be less light in the room (Go to red versus green) and improve the breakfast. Was a nice motel with very spacious room. Looked like the pool area was really nice with a kids basketball hoop. Got in late so didn't utilize it but it looked clean and nice. Beds were comfy and pillows good. Clean.
